definitions.definition: the act of causing somebody severe pain in order to punish them or make them say or do something

examples.text: Many of the refugees have suffered torture.
His confessions were made under torture.
I heard stories of gruesome tortures in prisons.

definitions.definition: mental or physical pain; something that causes this

examples.text: The interview was sheer torture from start to finish.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘distortion, twisting’, or a physical disorder characterized by this): via French from late Latin tortura ‘twisting, torment’, from Latin torquere ‘to twist’.
